refnamediv.refpurpose: Adds to the first arguments all remaining arguments

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The xte_nodebld_acc() function successively adds the remaining arguments to the first one. If the last items of the first argument and some following arguments are strings, they are concatenated. All successive strings are concatenated. The value of the first item is the number of the non-empty items in the returned vector. The length of the returned vector is the sum of the length of the first argument and number of the remaining arguments.

refsect2.title: acc
refsect2.para: A vector initiated by xte_nodebld_init() function and filled by xte_nodebld_acc() functions

refsect2.title: argI
refsect2.para: A string or a vector returned by xte_node_from_nodebld or xte_node functions

entry.errortext: The first argument of xte_nodebld_acc is not made by xte_nodebld_init() function

example.title: Simple Use
example.para: The length of the vector acc as the result of the two xte_nodebld_acc() calls below is equal to 4, but only three items are not empty:
'3' (number of not empty elements of the vector including this item)
vector corresponding the following XML element: <supplier CompanyName="Seller"> </supplier>
